abstract: Pres-elect Donald J Trump's pledge to repeal Affordable Care Act worries hospitals that frequently care for poor; health officials fear severe economic consequences and degradation of services they can provide if law that enabled hospitals to extend health insurance to patients who previously could not afford it is cut.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: As the president-elect and Congress prepare to repeal the law, Temple University Hospital and others serving the poor expect harsh consequences.
snippet: As the president-elect and Congress prepare to repeal the law, Temple University Hospital and others serving the poor expect harsh consequences....

headline.main: Hospitals in Safety Net Brace for Health Care Law’s Repeal
headline.print_headline: Safety-Net Hospitals Fear Cuts as Health Law’s Repeal Looms
